snippet: In allowing plastic and concrete replacements, the Public Design Commission would require parks officials to consider moving the center concrete strip.
abstract: New York City Public Design Commission votes to allow New York City's parks department to replace small section of the Coney Island Boardwalk with plastic and concrete instead of wood but not without conditions; seeks some changes to design to appease community members who bemoan loss of wood.

byline.original: By LISA W. FODERARO and LIZ ROBBINS

lead_paragraph: In allowing plastic and concrete replacements, the Public Design Commission would require parks officials to consider moving the center concrete strip.

headline.seo: Coney Island Boardwalk Closer to Concrete
headline.main: Coney Island Boardwalk Closer to Concrete
headline.print_headline: Coney Island Boardwalk Closer to Concrete
